backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining the application form data types and CRUD operations (submit, get, getAll) for a career program application system with three program options.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (PrivacyPolicyPage creation, cookie table, routing, footer link) to their source files, components, and test IDs with confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON catalog of short summaries for all frontend source files, describing each component's purpose and notable recent changes.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base CSS file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for the light and dark color themes used throughout the UI.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets the page title to 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator' and mounts the React app via the root div.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router configuration registering all application routes including the new /privacy-policy route that renders PrivacyPolicyPage.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Marketing section displaying US/Canada salary ranges ($95K–$180K) and a no-coding-required message with a career growth image.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Section listing six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, LinkedIn optimization, etc.) with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Section displaying a grid of six company names (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.) where graduates have interviewed.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Four-phase 8-month curriculum section rendered as a card grid covering Tech Foundations, Cloud Engineering, Kubernetes, and AI integration.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career support services (resume rewriting, LinkedIn optimization, SQL prep, etc.) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Displays the five-phase program curriculum (SQL, Python, Data Engineering, AI Integration, BI/Visualization) as cards with topics and outcome statements.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Renders an accordion-style FAQ section with six common questions and answers about the data analytics program.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section emphasizing Data+AI as a baseline expectation, with a button linking to the application page.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program, listing key skills with icons and a CTA button linking to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity by listing required skills and displaying US salary ranges for Data Analyst, Analytics Engineer, and Data Engineer roles.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price by contrasting what it is not (self-paced videos, tutorials) versus what it includes (live mentorship, projects, career support), with an apply CTA.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Displays the program format details (8-month duration, live sessions, labs, cohort size, etc.) as icon cards with a note about selective admission.
Showcases five portfolio projects students will build (sales dashboard, marketing analytics, data pipeline, AI reporting tool, business presentation) as cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Describes the target audience for the program (business graduates, MBAs, finance/marketing professionals, career switchers) with icon cards and a note that no prior coding or math is required.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Renders a section explaining why the Data Analytics program exists by displaying a grid of common problems with most data courses, each shown with an X icon.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Displays a section contrasting what the program is NOT (bootcamp, generic IT training, self-paced videos) with what it IS, using X and Check icon cards.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, payment plans, and program differences.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Displays three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data Analytics, QA Automation) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective detail pages.
A final call-to-action section with an 'Apply Now' link and 'Schedule a Call' button, promoting urgency around limited seats and the AI infrastructure job market.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Highlights why infrastructure engineers are AI-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and explaining the strategic, problem-solving, and collaborative skills required.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Hero section for the infrastructure program page featuring a headline, five core skill icons, and Apply/Download Curriculum CTA buttons over a background image.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: A condensed home-page FAQ accordion with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, job placement, cohort language/timezone, and differentiation from low-cost courses.
Main homepage hero section with a headline targeting career switchers, program highlights (8 months, live cohorts, mentors), and Apply/Brochure CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Outlines the three-step program process (Apply, Learn & Build, Launch) with icons and descriptions, followed by Apply and Schedule a Call CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays a section with four key impact metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a responsive grid layout.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Renders an instructor profile section highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and track record using icon cards alongside an instructor photo.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the main app layout with a sticky header (navigation with program dropdown, sign in/up buttons), a footer with a newsletter signup form, and an Outlet for page content.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Provides a lead capture form card where users submit their name, email, phone, and preferred call time to schedule a free admissions call, with a success confirmation state.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Shows a grid of four portfolio projects students will complete, each with an image, title, description, and a GitHub link indicator.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Displays a single pricing card at $2,999 listing all included program features, an ROI callout showing average $45k salary increase, and an Apply Now CTA button.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Presents six program structure features (duration, cohort model, limited seats, mentorship, recorded access, community) as icon cards, plus a program phases image.
Lists five real-world infrastructure projects students will build (cloud architecture, data pipeline, AI deployment, Kubernetes, CI/CD) with icons, descriptions, and supporting images.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career services (resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, interview prep, mock interviews, behavioral training, and a 60-day job plan) as a grid of icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Defines and renders a detailed 3-month curriculum for the QA Automation program, organized by month and week with topics, AI labs, and projects displayed as styled cards with badges.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Renders an FAQ section with five accordion items covering beginner-friendliness, automation coverage, AI's role, hiring outcomes, and program differentiation.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Renders a final call-to-action section urging users to apply for the next cohort, with a headline, supporting copy, and a link button to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Renders the hero section for the QA program page, featuring a headline, program tagline, a warning about AI replacing basic QA skills, key feature icons, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Renders a 'Why AI-Augmented QA?' section contrasting what AI can already automate versus what the program teaches, plus US salary range cards for QA roles.
frontend/src/components/QAOutcomesSectio: Renders a 'Program Outcomes' section listing seven skills graduates will have, displayed as a two-column grid of bordered cards with check icons.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Renders a pricing section showing the $1,999 program cost with a two-column comparison of what the program is not versus what it is, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Renders a program format section displaying seven structural details (duration, live sessions, projects, time commitment, cohort model, post-program support, and selective admission) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Renders a section displaying six QA program portfolio deliverables (GitHub framework, API tests, CI pipeline, docs, AI workflow, capstone) as cards with icons, plus a closing highlight banner.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Displays a grid of target audience personas for the QA program using icon cards, followed by a bold call-to-action banner emphasizing the program's practical focus.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Shows a 'Who This Program Is For' section with six audience types as checkmark cards and a 'No Prior Coding Experience Required' highlight box.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Renders three student testimonial cards with quotes, avatars, names, and roles for social proof on the marketing site.
Presents three core program features (cohort learning, career accelerator, AI curriculum) as icon-centered columns with a trust tagline below.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Lists five differentiators for Stack Teacher (portfolio projects, mentor cohorts, interview training, AI-native curriculum, placement coaching) as bordered cards with check icons.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation function wrapping the backend actor call, with loading and error state, invalidating the applications query on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication state, including login, logout, and identity persistence across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query hooks—`useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication`—that fetch application data from the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind CSS base imports and CSS custom properties for the design system's color tokens in both light and dark modes using OKLCH color values.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` into the DOM root.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Renders the About page for Stack Teacher, describing the platform's mission, offerings, target audiences, AI-era capabilities, career services, and approach using sections with icons and styled cards.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: Provides a multi-field application form for users to apply to a Stack Teacher program, handling form state and submission via the useApplicationForm hook, then navigating to a success page on completion.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: Displays a confirmation page after a successful program application, outlining the next steps (review, interview, decision) and prompting the user to return home.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling hero, features, programs, testimonials, FAQ, and other section components in sequence.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/PrivacyPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the full Privacy Policy page with structured sections covering key terms, data collection, usage, and user rights, formatted with prose styling and a table for key definitions.
Composes the AI-Augmented QA Automation Engineer Program landing page by assembling all relevant QA section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/TermsOfUsePage.tsx: Renders the Terms of Service page for Stack Teacher with multiple sections (Terms, Confidentiality, Use License, etc.) using Tailwind CSS prose styling. Serves as the layout/typography reference for the new PrivacyPolicyPage.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining the design system: CSS variable-based color tokens, custom font families (Inter, Cal Sans, JetBrains Mono), extended font sizes, border radii, box shadows, and accordion animations. Includes the tailwindcss-animate and @tailwindcss/typography plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks project state (version 3) for building a Privacy Policy page on stackteacher.com, listing four existing completed features (page component, cookies table, route registration, footer link) and one pending AR-1 request summarizing the full requirements.
